oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Plan général de la Ville du Caire
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Grand, Pierre Bey
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Le Caire, Égypte : Ebner et Cie
oai_dc:dc.dc:format: 1 map on 4 sheets : color ; 57 x 73 cm., each sheet 68 x 86
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The map includes avenues or Percements through the fabric of the old city. The important religious monuments of the city, Islamic and Christian, were differentiated both by color (red for mosques, and blue for churches and synagogues) and notation (numbers for the mosques, and letters for churches and synagogues). The map identified a total of 282 mosques on it, of which nine were unnamed. . . . close examination of the 1874 map reveals that this document was a project and not the actual description of the place. --- Arnaud (1993, p. 82).Arnaud, Jean-Luc. Maps of Cairo and the Development of the City at the End of the 19th Century. Environmental design: Journal of the Islamic Environmental Design Research Centre 1-2 (1993): 82-91. In Archnet - http://archnet.org/publications/3273
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Religious architecture -- Egypt -- Cairo -- Maps; Monuments -- Egypt -- Cairo -- Maps; Cairo (Egypt) -- Buildings, structures, etc. -- Maps
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Rare Books and Special Collections Library; the American University in Cairo
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: This item is in the public domain.
